meanings.definition: A title of respect or honor in some Middle Eastern countries.
meanings.sent1: In the Middle East, an agha is a person who is highly respected.
meanings.sent2: The agha received a medal for his outstanding service to the community.
meanings.sent3: When the agha walked into the room, everyone stood up to show their respect.
meanings.sent4: The agha's presence commanded attention and admiration from all around.
meanings.sent5: The agha's wise words were always listened to with great reverence.

meanings.definition: A Turkish title for a military officer or official.
meanings.sent1: The agha led the troops into battle with courage and determination.
meanings.sent2: The military agha was responsible for the safety of the soldiers under his command.
meanings.sent3: The agha's uniform was so shiny that it reflected the sunlight like a mirror.
meanings.sent4: The agha's orders were followed without question, showing his authority.
meanings.sent5: The agha's presence on the battlefield inspired confidence in his troops.

meanings.definition: A Turkish title for a civilian official.
meanings.sent1: The agha oversaw the construction of the new marketplace in the town.
meanings.sent2: As a civilian agha, he was responsible for resolving disputes among the townspeople.
meanings.sent3: The agha's office was always filled with people seeking his help and advice.
meanings.sent4: The agha's decisions as a civilian official greatly impacted the community.
meanings.sent5: The agha's fair judgment earned him the trust of all who lived in the town.
